Hell of Rebirth, Rebirth
In the past, present, and future, sentient beings return and are reborn,
Retreating and arising, and transmigrating, the World-Honored Buddha has seen and realized.
Karmic actions are not wasted, there are fruits and retributions that are not lost,
Maturing according to time and place, the sages and wise ones realize it themselves.
Gautama knows and speaks of these, the eight great hells,
The World-Honored One has seen and realized them all, becoming the eye of all dharmas.
The hells of rebirth, black rope, mountain collision, two wailing hells,
Small, large, two burning hot hells, and the great AvÄ«ci Hell,
Such are the eight hells, the Buddha says they are difficult to cross.
Evil people are always filled with them, each with sixteen partitions,
Four corners and four gates, each part is exactly the same,
One hundred yojanas high, and one hundred yojanas on each side,
Surrounded by iron walls, with an iron roof above.
The ground below is all iron, with blazing flames filling everywhere,
Burning evil people, terrifying, always burning, difficult to approach,
Those who see it will surely have their hair stand on end, the extreme suffering is unbearable to look at.
I will now explain for you, in accordance with the Dharma and in order,
Listen with respect and single-minded attention, as I speak the words.
There is a hell named 'Rebirth', all of iron, burning day and night, always with blazing light, long many yojanas, and as wide as that.
In this hell, the jailers seize the sinners, feet up and head down, according to the black rope, and chop with a hatchet.
At that time, after being chopped, only the remaining bones are connected by sinews, fainting and temporarily dead, with extremely heavy suffering, the jailers throw them away.
At that time, a cold wind blows and they come back to life, and because of this wind, their skin and flesh return to normal.
At that time, the nails of the sinful people grow sharp and hard like swords, and they give rise to mutual resentment towards their peers, thinking:
This person has done such evil to me in the past, so I should quickly kill him.
They give rise to the thought of killing in the same way.
They then stab each other, like cutting a hemp bush.

The people in this hell experience this kind of mutual harm, with suffering of the highest degree that is difficult to endure, extremely solid and strong, and most painful, until the experience of their evil karma is exhausted and they cannot die.
What kind of karma gives rise to this retribution, causing sentient beings to be born there?ğŸ”½In the past, among humans, many women had the same husband, and they were jealous of each other;
if many men competed for one woman, they gave rise to the mind of an enemy;

Or engaging in sexual misconduct with another's wife, or disputing over fields, gardens, and vehicles, or two kings disputing over neighboring lands, or being punished by the owner of stolen goods, forming enmity with each other, like people in a battle killing each other.
Having formed enmity, if they have not yet reconciled and apologized, bearing this they end their lives, and due to this karmic retribution they are reborn there.
Furthermore, due to various evil and unwholesome karmic retributions, they are reborn there. Furthermore, there is superior karma that leads to rebirth there.
Having been reborn there, they experience the fruits of various evil karma.
How does karmic cause lead sentient beings to injure and kill each other?
In the past, while human beings, they wielded axes, knives, and weapons, and slaughtered various living beings. Therefore, they experience the retribution of injuring each other there.
Furthermore, what karma is there for being blown by cold winds and reborn again?

In the past, when they were among humans, they raised and fed cattle, deer, pigs, sheep, chickens, ducks, and other animals. When they became fat and large, they killed them for their meat. Due to this karmic retribution, they encounter cold winds there and are able to temporarily revive.
How is it that due to karmic retribution, they are born with sharp claws like swords?
In the past, when they were among humans, they provided people with knives and weapons, and gave such instructions:
You can come to such-and-such a state, prefecture, and county, and go there to kill either humans or animals.
Due to this karmic retribution, they are born with sword-like claws.
Why is this hell called 'Rebirth'?
The sinners there have such thoughts:
'I am now reborn, and my flesh and body are as before.'
Therefore, it is called 'Rebirth.'
Moreover, this hell was originally named 'Rebirth.'
At that time, the World-Honored One, wishing to restate this meaning, spoke a verse, saying:
In the hell of Rebirth, the head is below and the feet are above,
Holding axes and other tools, they follow the rope and suddenly strike.
At that time, having been struck, only a pile of bones remains,
Blood, flesh, skin, and sinews, etc., return to being born as before.
The sharp sword at the tip of the finger and the claws, due to karma, are naturally born,
Following the mind of hatred and resentment from the past, they again strike each other with swords.
Having received the harm of being struck with swords, a cool wind blows again,
Giving rise to all the limbs, the wind of contention is caused by karma.
The TathÄgata, the teacher of humans and gods, having seen this as it truly is,
Therefore, he speaks of rebirth, the abode of those who create evil.
The chapter on the realm of rebirth is concluded.
Next, the hell named Black Rope, all of which is iron, burns day and night, the fire always blazing, long and many yojanas, and also as wide as that.

In this hell, the wardens seize the sinners, throw them to the ground, and lay them down like a living tree. They cut them with axes along the black ropes, making them octagonal, hexagonal, or four-cornered.ğŸ”½Some sinners are chopped from the heels to the neck with axes, like sugarcane joints.
Some sinners are finely cut with axes from the neck to the feet, also like sugarcane joints.
The hell beings suffer this mutilation, with pain that is extremely difficult to endure, extremely strong and most intense, until their evil karma is exhausted and they cannot die.
What kind of karmic actions give rise to this result, causing sentient beings to be born there?

In the past, while among humans, they committed such karma, following worldly laws and regulations, following worldly measurements and judgments, doing it themselves and teaching others to do the same, with such heavy punishments - cutting off so many hands, cutting off so many feet, cutting off noses and ears in such quantities;
cutting off so much flesh from their backs or cutting off both thighs, five or ten pounds - because of this karmic retribution, these beings are born there;
there are also various evil and unwholesome karmic retributions born there, and furthermore, there is superior karma that leads to birth there.
Having been born there, they experience various evil and unwholesome karmic retributions.
At that time, the wardens in that place scolded and frightened the suffering people, saying:
'Evil people, get up, don't move.
' At that time, the minds of the countless sinners were greatly frightened, and they all stood still like a forest of banners.
At that time, iron robes and iron kaá¹£Äya garments are always burning, emitting great blazing flames. Countless millions of red iron kaá¹£Äya garments and red iron robes descend from the sky.
At that time, the sinful people cry out:ğŸ”½Here comes the robe!
Here comes the robe!
When the robe arrives, it wraps each person individually. The skin, flesh, sinews, and bones all become scorched and rotten. When they are scorched and rotten, the iron robe leaves on its own.

The people in this hell experience this burning, the most intense and unbearable suffering, extremely solid and strong, the most painful and harsh, until the retribution for their evil karma is exhausted and they cannot die.
What kind of karmic actions lead to receiving this karmic retribution, causing sentient beings to be born there?

In the past, among humans, they held whips and sticks to beat and strike sentient beings with lives, either with leather whips, or using rattan vines, or again using fish tails to whip and shackle sentient beings.
There are also those who, as renunciant monks, break the precepts, accept the country's clothing and belts, and experience rebirth there as a result of that karmic retribution.
Moreover, various evil and unwholesome fruits of retribution are born there.
Furthermore, there is superior karma that leads to rebirth there.
Having been born there, one experiences various unwholesome fruits of retribution.
There are sinful people whose skin is flayed by the jailers, stopping at the neck without completely removing it;
and the jailers also flay the skin from the neck to the heels, stopping there without completely removing it.

There are also sinners whose skin is flayed from the neck to the waist, stopping there, or whose skin is flayed from the waist to the heels, stopping there, causing the skin on the sinners' bodies to hang down, trailing and dragging on the ground, and stepping on the ground themselves, with pain difficult to bear.
It is like the clothes worn by people in the world, which are not neat and orderly in length and width, and the skin on their bodies is also like this.

The people in this hell experience self-amputation and skinning, with suffering of the highest degree that is difficult to endure, extremely firm and strong, and most painful, until the retribution for their evil karma is exhausted and they cannot die.
What kind of karmic actions lead to receiving this retribution, causing sentient beings to be born there?

In the past, while human, they engaged in such activities. They skinned living beings alive, causing the skin to be removed but still attached to their bodies, resembling clothing for play and other purposes;
Furthermore, in the past, while human, they whipped and beat sentient beings, either doing it themselves or being instructed by others;
Furthermore, as renunciants, they broke the precepts and used the country's clothing, bedding, and other necessities. Due to these karmic actions, they are reborn there;
There are also various other evil and unwholesome karmic retributions that lead to rebirth there. Furthermore, there are superior karmic actions that lead to rebirth there.
Having been born there, they experience various unwholesome karmic retributions.
In this hell, there is extreme darkness, filled with thick smoke, the smoke is dry and caustic, splitting the skin, tearing the flesh, penetrating the bones and marrow.
This poisonous touch of the smoke pervades the body inside and out. The jailers drive and force them into the smoke, and then place them there.
These sinful people, fearing and avoiding this smoke, run about in all directions for countless yojanas, trampling on each other's skin and causing each other suffering.

These hell beings experience the poisonous touch of this smoke, suffering of the highest degree, difficult to endure, extremely strong and most painful, until their evil karma and retribution are exhausted and they cannot die.
What kind of karmic actions lead to this retribution, causing sentient beings to be born there?

In the past, as a human, he made a high and secluded room to smoke people to death, or made a prison to smoke people to death, or was a wild boar, a carp, an otter, a fox, a cat, a rat, a cunning bee, etc., all in the ditches, in their holes he made smoke to smoke them out, even mosquitoes and gadflies he smoked out to chase them away, by this karmic retribution he was born there;
Furthermore, there are various kinds of evil and unwholesome karmic retributions born there, and furthermore, by superior karma he is born there.
Having been born there, he experiences various unwholesome karmic retributions.
Why is this hell called Black Rope?
In this hell, the sinners are cut and hacked along the boundaries of black ropes, and suffer greatly, therefore it is called Black Rope.
Furthermore, it is originally named Black Rope by its own nature.
In order to further explain this meaning, he spoke a verse:
The jailers in the Black Rope hell, cut the sinners like trees,
Following the black-string boundary path, holding a hatchet to chop.
Next, the red-iron garment, burning hot day and night,
Wrapping and pressing the sinners, blood and flesh flowing and drying up.
Peeling the skin from the feet to the neck, and from the neck to the waist,
In the black-string hell, many have no skin and only red flesh.
In the terrifying darkness, poisonous smoke fills everywhere,
The jailers force them to enter, and after entering, they are abandoned.
Running for many yojanas, shrouded in smoke and darkness, unable to see,
Stepping on each other's skin, both self and other suffer greatly.
Herein, the cause and effect, the Buddha himself knows as they truly are,
Thus it is said, the black-string hell, the abode of evil people.
The chapter on the Black-string Hell is concluded.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
The Great Street Hell Between the two hells of Reviving and Black Rope, there is a hell called Great Street, like a great market street.
In this hell, the sinners sometimes sleep face up, sometimes sleep face down, or are placed in a mortar and pounded with an iron pestle.
Some sinners are cut into pieces from head to toe.
Some sinners have their skin flayed off and spread on the ground, and their flesh is cut off and piled on top of the skin.
There are also sinners whose hands are cut off when they lower their swords, and whose hands grow back when they raise their swords. For this reason, the pile of their hands is as high as a mountain.
Their feet, ears, nose, and head are cut off when they lower their swords, and grow back when they raise their swords. The pile of their heads, noses, and so on is also as high as a mountain.
Until the retribution for their evil karma is exhausted, they cannot die.
What kind of karmic actions lead to rebirth in that place and receive such retribution?

In the past, while among humans, they engaged in the occupation of butchers, killing sheep, pigs, cattle, deer, and so forth to make a living, or they caught fish and birds, or served as prison guards, or engaged in robbery and theft themselves, or executed criminals. Due to these karmic retributions, they are reborn there;
Furthermore, there are various evil karmic acts that lead to rebirth there. Moreover, there are superior karmic acts that lead to rebirth there.
Having been reborn there, they experience various retributions for unwholesome karmic acts.
These hell beings have heads like elephant heads and bodies like human bodies;ğŸ”½There are also sinful beings with heads like horse heads and bodies like human bodies;
There are also sinful beings with heads like ox heads and bodies also like humans;
There are various such types, not the same.
Here, the prison guards seize the sinful beings and drive them with iron carts, burning day and night with constant flames. The carts are made of red-hot iron and are tied with red-hot iron ropes.
The road is all iron, long and many yojanas, and also wide like this. The jailers there hold red-hot iron spears and drive them back and forth.
They suffer such harm, the most severe pain difficult to bear, extremely solid, extremely strong, and most painful, until the use of their evil karma is exhausted and they cannot die.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born there and receive such retribution?
In the past, among humans, some were elephant tamers, some were horse tamers, some were ox tamers, and some were riders. Because of this karma, they are born there;
Furthermore, various evil karmic retributions cause them to be born there. There is superior karma that causes them to be born there;
Having been born there, they experience various unwholesome karmic retributions.
There are also sentient beings there whose heads are cow heads and bodies are human bodies, some have deer heads and human bodies, and some have pig heads and human bodies:
There are many such kinds, innumerable.
The jailers gather in large numbers, surround them, and hold bows, swords, and various weapons to cut and stab the offenders.
They undergo this mutilation, suffering of the highest degree, difficult to endure, extremely firm and strong, the most painful, until the use of their evil karma is exhausted and they cannot die.
What kind of karma leads to receiving this retribution, causing sentient beings to be born there?

In the past, while among humans, they held knives and sticks, hunted in the fields, and set nets to capture living beings. Surrounded by many people, they either cut or stabbed, killed or harmed. Because of these karmas, they are born there;
Furthermore, various evil karmic retributions lead to being born there. There is also a dominant karma that leads to being born there.
Having been born there, they experience various retributions for unwholesome karma.
There is a tree there called 'reverse thorn' Å›aá¹ƒbhala, all of which are iron, burning day and night, always emitting light and flames.
The trees are one yojana tall, with thorns sixteen inches long.
The prison guards there grab the arms of the offenders and pull them up onto the thorny trees, then pull them down again.
When pulled up, the thorns bend down; when pulled down, the thorns point up.
When pulled up and down, if the belly touches the tree, the skin and flesh are completely gone;
if the back touches the tree, the skin and flesh are also gone.
The skin and flesh on the belly regenerate, and the skin and flesh on the sides and back regenerate in the same way. For this reason, they are pulled up and down along the belly, sides, and back.

The offenders experience this mutilation, suffering in the highest degree, difficult to endure, extremely strong and excruciating pain, until their karmic retribution is exhausted, but they cannot die.
What karma did they create in the past that results in their being born there?

In the past, while among humans, they engaged in sexual misconduct with the wives of others, or there were women who deceived and betrayed their husbands. Due to these and other karmic actions, they are born there. Furthermore, various evil karmic retributions are born there. There are also superior karmic retributions born there.
Having been born there, they experience various retributions for unwholesome karmic actions.
In that hell there are also many mountains of red-hot coals, burning day and night with constant flames.
The wardens of hell grab the arms of the offenders and pull them up and down, pressing them against the mountains, burning their skin and flesh to the point of exhaustion;
if they press their backs against the mountains, their skin and flesh are also exhausted.
The belly recovers as before, and the skin and flesh of the back and sides are born again. For this reason, they are pulled up and down according to the belly, sides, and back.

In this way, the offenders experience this kind of harm, suffering of the highest degree, difficult to endure, extremely firm and strong, the most painful, until the experience of their evil karma is exhausted, but they cannot die.
What karma did they create in the past to receive this retribution, causing sentient beings to be born there?

In the past, while among humans, they took living beings, threw them into fire, or into hot sand, or hot ashes, or threw them into filthy places, or made cows and horses pull carts through hot sand. Because of these karmic actions, they are born there.
Furthermore, various evil karmic retributions cause birth there, and there is also supreme karmic retribution that leads to birth there.
Having been born there, they experience various retributions for unwholesome karmic actions.
The Third Hell, the Saá¹ƒghÄta Hell, the Saá¹ƒghÄta Hell Chapter There is another hell called Saá¹ƒghÄta, whose appearance is like between two mountains.
The wardens in this hell hold various weapons and frighten the offenders. At that time, the offenders are all afraid and enter between the two mountains.

Countless thousands of people entered the middle of the mountain, and there was a great mass of fire blocking the road ahead. At that time, the sinful people saw this fierce fire and wanted to shrink back, but they saw a great mass of fire behind them. They rolled around in confusion, and the two mountains then came together.
When the two mountains came, all the sinful people cried out and said such words:ğŸ”½The mountain has come!
The mountain has come!
The mountain then came together, like pressing sesame oil, and the mountain pressed the sinful people in the same way.
After pressing them, the mountain opened up and rose up. The sinful people saw the mountain rise up and scrambled to enter under it, but the mountain then fell again and pressed down on their bodies.
It was like a press pressing various animals, with blood flowing to form rivers, leaving only sinews and bones, without any skin or flesh.

They undergo this residual harm, the most severe and unbearable suffering, extremely solid and strong, the most painful, until the karmic retribution of their evil deeds is exhausted and they cannot die.
What kind of past karma leads to receiving this retribution, causing sentient beings to be born there?

In the past, among humans, they covered people with bamboo and rattan mats and had elephants trample them, or during battles, they made crushing carts to crush people, and also hung stones on ropes to lower and kill people. They also set up traps and pits on dangerous roads to kill sentient beings, or used their nails and teeth to bite lice and fleas. Due to such karma, they receive this retribution and are born there.
There are also various kinds of unwholesome karma that lead to being born there. There is also supreme karma that leads to being born there.
Having been born there, they experience the retribution of various kinds of unwholesome karma.
Among them, the sinful people are left with only sinews and bones, without any blood or flesh. At that time, the jailers say to their companions:
'We will now grind the sinners together with you for the duration of a finger snap.'
They then seize the sinners and place them in a hot iron mortar, grinding their bodies to pieces with a hot iron pestle.
For the duration of a finger snap, it is equivalent to five hundred years in the human realm.
They experience this residual harm, the most severe suffering, as explained above.
What karma did they create in the past that would lead sentient beings to be born there?

In the past, while among humans, they may have held spears, lances, and halberds to stab and harm sentient beings, or they may have threshed grain, hemp, and wheat together with insects. Due to these kinds of karma, they are born there.
There are also various kinds of unwholesome karmic retributions that lead to birth there, and there are also superior karmas that lead to birth there.
Having been born there, they experience various kinds of unwholesome karmic retributions.
Why is this hell called 'Crushing Together'?
In this hell, the sinners are gathered together in one place, and the two mountains crush them together, thus it is called 'Crushing Together.'
Moreover, this hell was originally named Gathering and Banging, thus it is called Gathering and Banging.
Again speaking in verse:
In the Gathering and Banging Hell, in the middle of two large mountains,
Countless sinners enter, like a herd of deer gathering.
Due to the retribution of past karma, these two mountains come together,
Banging and crushing many beings, with a mass of fire blocking the front and back.
From the bodies of the sinners, flowing blood forms rivers.
Thus experiencing hardship, they cannot die in the middle,
Placed on a red iron boat, beaten with a mace,
Experiencing the retribution of past karma, for five hundred years in the snap of a finger.
The TathÄgata, the teacher of humans and gods, sees this as it truly is,
Therefore it is said that Gathering and Banging is the dwelling place of evil-doers.
The chapter on the Gathering and Banging Hell is concluded.
4. The Roaring Hell The fourth hell is called the Roaring Hell. Its appearance is like a narrow room, with countless thousands.
In that hell, each criminal is in a single room. The body is large and the room small, cramped and miserable, with the four deportments cut off, and suffering from burning and harm.
When the fire burns below the criminal, if the fire is fierce, the cries are loud. If the fire is weak, the cries are low.

Suffering this burning, the pain is of the highest degree, difficult to endure. It is extremely solid, extremely strong, and most excruciating. One cannot die until the karmic retribution for evil deeds is exhausted.
What karmic actions in the past lead to this retribution, causing sentient beings to be born there?

In the past, among humans, those who themselves or caused others to inflict heavy punishments on helpless and dependent beings, those who themselves or caused others to burn down forests, those who themselves or caused others to build secret chambers to burn people to death, those who themselves or caused others to build prisons to torture people with fire, those who themselves or caused others to burn the dens of badgers, carps, otters, foxes, rats, and other such creatures, and even those who themselves or caused others to smoke out mosquitoes and flies with fire, were reborn there as a result of such karma.
There are also various other evil karmic retributions that lead to rebirth there, and furthermore, by superior karma one is reborn there.
Having been reborn there, one experiences various retributions for unwholesome karma.
The fifth hell in the Great Howling Hell is called the Great Howling Hell. Its appearance is like a large pit, countless yojanas wide and long, all of red iron, as described above.

The jailers in this hell hold iron hammers to threaten the offenders. When the offenders see this, they become terrified, either fleeing or not fleeing, running around aimlessly or facing the wall, or praising and flattering, or begging for mercy.
At that time, the jailers ask those who come to meet them:
Why do you dare to come and meet me?
They then use the iron hammer to smash their heads, like breaking a curd pot, and the shattered head is splattered like that;
They tell those who do not come to meet them:
Why do you dare not come?
They also smash their heads as before;
Those who run around, those who do not run, those who face the wall, those who do not flee, are each asked and beaten in the same way.
For this reason, all of them have their heads smashed, with none escaping.

One receives this most severe and intense suffering, which is extremely difficult to endure, extremely strong, and most painful, until the retribution for one's evil karma is exhausted and one cannot die.
What kind of past karma leads to receiving this retribution, causing sentient beings to be born there?

In the past, while among humans, one dug pits to make prisons, and if a criminal was placed in them, one made them unable to see the light of the sun and moon. Because of this karma, one is born there as retribution;
There are also various kinds of evil karmic retributions that lead to being born there. Furthermore, superior karma leads to being born there.
Having been born there, one experiences various retributions for unwholesome karma.
What kind of karma leads to receiving the retribution of a shattered head?

In the past, while among humans, one smashed the heads of living beings, or various kinds of beings such as fish, snakes, and centipedes. Because of these kinds of karma, one receives the retribution of a shattered head.
The suffering of being burned and roasted in this hell is even more intense than before, and one always suffers from having one's head shattered and so on.
Why is this hell called Great Screaming?

In this hell, the sinners, due to the beating and the fire, scream loudly and wail greatly, only the loud screams and wails have no meaning or expression, they are not even able to call out to their mother or father, therefore this hell is called Great Screaming.
Moreover, the intrinsic nature is called Great Screaming.
Again, he spoke a verse, saying:
In the Screaming Hell, many people are squeezed together,ğŸ”½The fire below if it burns greatly, the screams and wails are terrifying.
If the power of the fire is weak, the screams also follow and decrease,
The suffering of the destruction of dignity and the pain of burning.
The second Great Screaming, the deep darkness makes the hair stand on end,
The sheer cliffs are unclimbable, vast and innumerable.
The jailers in there, holding red-hot iron boards,
Smash the heads like enemies, for countless hundreds of thousands of years.
The TathÄgata, the teacher of humans and gods, having seen this as it truly is,
Therefore speaks of the two wailing hells, where evil-doers dwell.
The chapter on the great and small wailing hells is concluded.
The sixth hell, the burning hell, is named the burning hell. Its appearance is like a kiln, all made of iron, burning day and night, always emitting flames, vast and long, countless yojanas.
In this hell, countless thousands and millions of sinners are confined and burned, cooked inside and out, hollow and brittle, easily detached, like dried meat.

At that time, the gates of the hell naturally open. Outside the gates, there are countless dogs, some black and some mottled, with tall and large bodies. They wait for the gates to open, then rush into the hell, pull out the sinners, and bite their bodies, like toppling living trees, and eat them to their heart's content.
After being eaten, only a pile of bones remained, skin and flesh all gone. In that place of suffering, he fainted at that time. A cold wind blew and the skin and flesh grew back.
At that time, the jailer drove him in again, and he received the previous suffering of being burned, roasted, and eaten. The suffering of the highest grade is as described above.
What past karma and retribution caused sentient beings to be born there?

In the past, among humans, they built prisons without doors, adding soil, elephant dung, mixed with mud and plaster, and plastered the ground. They mixed salt with Gomasirsa oil and splashed the bodies of criminals, threw them into prison, and exposed them to the sunlight. In one night, they swelled up and rotted, either steamed or boiled to death, or killed criminals with fire, or boiled silkworm cocoons, or fried sentient beings. For this karmic retribution, they were born there;
There are also various evil karmic retributions and superior karmic retributions that lead to rebirth in that intermediate state, as described above.
Moreover, due to what karma are they eaten by dogs?

In the past, among humans, they raised lions, tigers, leopards, bears, wolves, and dogs, and made them bite and devour living beings. Due to these karmas, they receive rebirth in that intermediate state, the rest as described above.
In the past, what karma did they create to be blown by cold winds?
In the past, among humans, they raised and fed beings for their flesh. Due to this karma, they are touched by cold winds.
Why is this hell called 'burning'?
In this hell, the sinful beings are burned in body and mind, thus it is called 'burning'.
Moreover, the intrinsic nature is called 'burning'.
Again, he spoke a verse:ğŸ”½In the Burning Hell, the iron houses are greatly ablaze,
The hot air is extremely intense, like a burning fire.
The sinners who commit offenses here are tightly sealed and roasted,
Just as they did in their past actions, they receive the suffering retribution here.
At that time, when the body is already cooked, a group of dogs compete to eat it,
The skin and flesh all melt away, leaving only bones as a remainder.
When a cool wind comes and blows, the skin and flesh return to their original state,
The jailers drive them in again, and they undergo the previous suffering again.
The TathÄgata, the teacher of humans and gods, sees this as it truly is,
Therefore, he says this is the place where sinners who commit offenses reside and are roasted.
The chapter on the Saá¹ƒjÄ«va hell is concluded.

The seventh hell, named the MahÄraurava hell, is also called the MahÄraurava hell. Its appearance is like a high and wide mountain, all of which is red iron, burning day and night, always emitting light and flames.
There are sharp, red-hot skewers, extremely painful when burned, always emitting light and flames, surrounding everywhere above and below.

Some sinners are skewered by one skewer and roasted on the fire mountain, some by two or three skewers, some by ten, twenty, up to a hundred thousand skewers, pierced horizontally and vertically and roasted on the fire mountain.
If one side is already cooked, the skewer turns by itself and roasts the other side.
Some sinners pull out the iron skewers by themselves, pierce the uninjured parts, and turn them over to be roasted.

When the sinners enter, the worms pierce their skin, enter their flesh, penetrate their bones, and eat their marrow.
When they experience this suffering, for countless thousands of years they constantly cry out loudly, until their evil karma is exhausted and they cannot die.

Having left this hell, they see a sword-leafed forest, seeking refuge, rescue, and escape, running quickly towards the forest, on the road various spikes and barbs tear and pierce their bodies and feet.

Next, they enter the sword forest. At that time, a hot wind blows, causing the sword trees to move. The wind touches them like fire, burning their entire bodies. The sword forest rains down various weapons, cutting and stabbing their bodies, leaving no skin or flesh wherever they strike.
They suffer this harm for countless thousands of years, constantly crying out, until their evil karma is exhausted and they cannot die.
There are also various birds and beasts that eat their bodies, all as described above.
Having left this hell, they see a river of hot lye overflowing with boiling water. Seeking refuge, rescue, and escape, they run and enter the river, rolling over like beans being cooked.
On the shore, there are jail guards holding iron nets who scoop out the sinners and place them on the red-hot shore.

And in the future crying out and receiving various bitter fruits?
When evil karma is not yet ripe, the foolish person considers it sweet,
But when that karma has ripened, only then does one know it is bitter and difficult.
When first creating evil karma, it is not like fire immediately burning,

The sinner is often very intelligent, harming everything,

Evil wisdom harms oneself, like punishing an enemy,
